away.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: used to say that someone leaves a place or person, or stays some distance from a place or person
away.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Dinah was crying as she drove slowly away.
away.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: She turned away and stared out of the window.
Charley blushed and looked away, embarrassed.
away.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: if someone is away from school, work, or home, they are not there
away.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: You must bring a note from your parents if you’ve been away from school.
away.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: used to say how far it is to a place or thing
away.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: There’s another hotel not far away.
The beach is only five minutes away  (=it only takes five minutes to get there).
She was sitting ten feet away from the microphone.
away.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: if an event is two days, three weeks etc away, it will happen after that period of time has passed
away.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Christmas is only a month away.
away.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: used to say how close someone is to achieving something or experiencing something
away.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: At one stage, they were just two points away from victory.
away.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: into or in a safe or enclosed place
away.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: Put your money away, I’m paying.
Thousands of archaeological treasures are being kept hidden away.
away.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: used to show that something disappears or is removed
away.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: Ruben gave all his money away to charity.
Support for the Democrats has dropped away.
Cut away all the dead wood.
away.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: used to emphasize that an action continues
away.translation[0].definitions[8].examp: Sue was singing away to herself in the bath.
They’ve been hammering away all day.
away.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: used to say that someone spends the whole of a period of time doing something
away.translation[0].definitions[9].examp: You can dance the night away in one of Benidorm’s many discos.
away.translation[0].definitions[10].defi: if a team is playing away, it is playing a game at its opponent’s field or sports hall
away.translation[0].definitions[10].exam: Liverpool are playing away at Everton on Saturday.
away.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: an away game or match is played at your opponent’s field or sports hall
